questions.question: ‘I can’t speak French.’ ‘……………………. can I.’
questions.description: Neither/nor + auxiliary + subject can be used to make a negative addition to a negative statement.

questions.question: You are ………………………… generous.
questions.description: Either very or so can be used here.

questions.question: We reserved the table in advance so that we …………………………. to wait.
She has bought ……………………………. car.
questions.description: Another can mean different or an extra.

questions.question: Where is ……………………………… book you borrowed from me?
Trains run ………………………….. ten minutes.
questions.description: Every can be used before plural expressions in measurements of frequency.

questions.question: Manali is famous for its beautiful …………………………..
questions.description: Scenery does not have a plural form.

questions.question: Sania and Rohan …………………………….. arrived.
questions.description: When two singular subjects are connected by and, they should be followed by a plural verb.

questions.question: The principal as well as the teachers …………………………. present at the meeting.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former in number and person.

questions.question: The mother along with her daughters …………………………….. outside.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with along with, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: Between you and ………………………….., there are no secrets.
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: Start at once, so that you ……………………………. miss the train.
